movie_title: Keeping cars out of city centres - 6 Minute English
introduction:
Improve your English vocabulary and speaking with 6 Minute English from the BBC. 
In this programme,

vocabulary.definition: a person who is walking, usually in an area where there's traffic
vocabulary.example: Sorry, you can't ride your bike here. The path is for pedestrians only.

vocabulary.definition: to make an effort to deal with a difficult problem
vocabulary.example: The government isn't really tackling the problem of air pollution. It needs to do much more.

vocabulary.definition: to say officially that something can't be done
vocabulary.example: The UK government will ban the sale of diesel and petrol cars from 2040.

vocabulary.definition: to change the direction you're travelling in
vocabulary.example: The council has rerouted all buses to avoid the town centre.

vocabulary.definition: too much traffic, making it difficult to move
vocabulary.example: Road congestion always gets better in the summer when a lot of car drivers are on holiday.

vocabulary.definition: damage to the environment caused by releasing waste substances such as carbon dioxide into the air
vocabulary.example: You can help reduce air pollution by walking to work every day instead of driving.
